subject: SwingUI and AWTUI don't work with PROJECTX?
msgSnippet: Hello everybody, I m using the JUnit framework to test an application that uses the factory of DOM trees of the PROJECTX (The SUN implementation of DOM)
messageBody:
Hello everybody,

I'm using the JUnit framework to test an application that uses the factory
of DOM trees of the PROJECTX (The SUN implementation of DOM) libraries.
Everything was great while I was using the text only interface of JUnit.
Then, I decided to move to the SWING interface, but then the application
stopped working. I tried with AWT interface, and I obtained the same error.
This error is:

java.lang.IncompatibleClassChangeError: class com.sun.xml.tree.XmlDocument
does not implement interface org.w3c.dom.Document
at optica.api.bd.QueryToXML.buildXML(QueryToXML.java:215)
at optica.api.bd.QueryToXML.execute(QueryToXML.java:45)
at optica.api.bd.TransformNames.execute(TransformNames.java:103)
at optica.api.bd.QueryToXMLTest.testConexionBBDD(QueryToXMLTest.java:108)

and the line 215 is:

Element rowset = doc.createElement(aRowSet);

doc is a DOM Document, and aRowSet is a String.

Then I decided to change the PROJECTX libraries for the XML4J from IBM. And
it works!!!

The questions are: Why can I run this test in text mode ? Why can't I use
the PROJECTX libraries with the graphical interface of Junit ?

Any help will be welcomed.
Bye

Diego Parrilla

P.D.: Excuse me for my high-school english.
